title: Drawing, "Design for a Cup", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, brown ink, graphite on cream tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink lower center: "COUPE," at lower right: "J.P./36/(square root sign) 2."
dimensions: 40.2 X 20.2 cm (17 5/8 X 12 3/16 in.), irregular sheet
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Cylindrical cup flaring at the top drawn in plan and elevation. The cup supported on two inverted saucer-shaped bases indicated in brown ink separated by a wide silver band and flanked by an applied band grooved on the outer edge conforming to the contour of the base. Underdrawing in graphite of cup in golden section.
Puiforcat collection contains archival photograph of the cup, with base in rosewood, Box 7, Folder 19, "Cups, 9000 series" # 9127.
Puiforcat Fabrication #: 9127.
